tool.name: SAGA.grid_calculus.21
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayGRID False isArrayREFERENCE False output_data_MATCHED $output_data_MATCHED name SAGA.grid_calculus.21 GRID $GRID REFERENCE $REFERENCE METHOD $METHOD NCLASSES $NCLASSES MAXSAMPLES $MAXSAMPLES prefer $prefer response $response outputType_MATCHED $OutputSection_MATCHED.outputType_MATCHED transmissionMode_MATCHED $OutputSection_MATCHED.transmissionMode_MATCHED

param.name: GRID
param.label: Grid
param.help: Grid The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: REFERENCE
param.label: Reference Grid
param.help: Reference Grid The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: NCLASSES
param.label: Histogramm Classes
param.help: Number of histogram classes for internal use.

param.name: MAXSAMPLES
param.label: Maximum Sample Size
param.help: If set to zero all data will be used to build the histograms.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_MATCHED
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: This tool alters the values of a grid so that its value distribution (its histogram), matches that of a reference grid. The first method simply uses arithmetic mean and standard deviation for adjustment, which usually is sufficient for normal distributed values. The second method performs a more precise adjustment based on the grids' histograms.
